plot module

plot.colors(c: str) → List[str]

Get hex colors pleasantly viewed with seaborn style of plotting.

Parameters:

c (str) – string code for the desired color category. Should be one of [‘blue’, ‘red’, ‘green’, ‘orange’]

Returns:

list of hexadecimal color codes in the desired category

Return type:

(List[str])

plot.plot_grid_lines(ax, xmax, ymin, ymax, xmin=0)
plot.set_ax_info(ax, xlabel, ylabel, title=None, zlabel=None, legend=True)

Write title and labels on an axis with the correct fontsizes.

Parameters:

  • ax (matplotlib.axis) – the axis on which to display information

  • xlabel (str) – the desired label on the x-axis

  • ylabel (str) – the desired label on the y-axis

  • title (str, optional) – the desired title on the axis default: None

  • zlabel (str, optional) – the desired label on the z-axis for 3D-plots default: None

  • legend (bool, optional) – whether or not to add labels/legend default: True

plot.use_tex()
